questions.question: Which of the following best describes emotional intelligence (EI) in a professional telecom environment?

options.text: Understanding and managing one’s emotions, and recognizing those of others to improve collaboration
Using emotional appeals to persuade customers during calls
Avoiding emotional discussions in team meetings
Reacting quickly and instinctively without overthinking situations

questions.question: You’re a Sky graduate engineer working in a cross-functional team. During a sprint review, a colleague criticizes your work harshly in front of others. What’s the most emotionally intelligent way to handle it?

options.text: Stay silent, but later complain to your manager about the colleague
Acknowledge their feedback calmly, thank them, and suggest discussing improvements privately after the meeting
Ignore the comment and continue the discussion as if nothing happened
Respond with sarcasm to lighten the mood

questions.question: In an Agile development environment at Sky, what is the primary purpose of a daily stand-up?

options.text: To present completed deliverables to stakeholders
To discuss company-wide strategic goals
To ensure every team member updates others on progress, blockers, and next steps
To assign tasks to team members for the day

questions.question: You’re part of a scrum team developing a new customer self-service feature. Mid-sprint, marketing requests a new functionality that could improve engagement. What’s the best Agile response?

options.text: Immediately stop current work and implement the new feature
Log the request in the product backlog, discuss with the Product Owner, and prioritize it for the next sprint
Add the task to the sprint quietly if time allows
Ask the Scrum Master to decide unilaterally whether to add it

questions.question: Which of the following best aligns with GDPR compliance within a telecom company?

options.text: Sharing customer data across departments without consent for 'internal use'
Encrypting customer data, minimizing its collection, and processing it only for legitimate purposes
Retaining all customer call data indefinitely for analytics
Selling anonymized data to third parties without disclosure

questions.question: You’re building an internal analytics dashboard using customer viewing data. A teammate suggests including names and email addresses to make debugging easier. What’s the most compliant approach?

options.text: Accept the suggestion; debugging convenience outweighs privacy
Use only anonymized or pseudonymized data in the dashboard
Include full personal data but restrict access to managers only
Proceed since the dashboard is for internal use only

questions.question: Which of the following is a hallmark of effective communication in a hybrid telecom workplace?

options.text: Sending long, detailed emails to ensure no information is missed
Adapting tone, medium, and detail based on the audience and purpose
Avoiding video calls to save bandwidth
Using technical jargon consistently across all messages

questions.question: You’re presenting a technical network solution to a non-technical operations manager. Halfway through, they seem confused. What should you do?

options.text: Continue the presentation; they’ll understand when they see the results
Pause, ask what part was unclear, and re-explain using analogies or simpler terms
End the meeting and send them detailed documentation later
Apologize and ask them to read up on the topic beforehand

questions.question: Which of the following is not typically part of a telecom company’s core service offering like Sky’s?

options.text: Broadband internet
Satellite television
Cloud-based data analytics solutions for customers
On-demand video streaming

questions.question: You’re working on improving customer experience for Sky’s broadband product. Data shows customers frequently experience connection drops during peak hours. What’s the most effective product improvement approach?

options.text: Launch a marketing campaign explaining that peak congestion is normal
Investigate infrastructure bottlenecks and test optimized load balancing or capacity upgrades
Reduce connection speeds temporarily to stabilize performance
Increase subscription prices to reduce customer load
